Kids: ^A photo of your kids, I presume?
^It must be a lot of work, taking care of them.
^Not well, these days. We're always tired, always low on money, don't know how we're making it--
^Yes, honey. That's quite enough. We're managing.
Money: ^That's quite a lot of cash, Mrs. Rosa.
^Yes. We have a lot of children.
^We have to save what we can, in case of emergencies.
^And you always carry around this money on you?
^You never know when you'll need it.
^That's my wife. She always comes prepared.
^Looks like she takes care of the bills, too.
^They look so fresh. How long would you say they've been in your purse?
^I don't know. I don't count the days, Mr. Trilby.
^Why do you care so much about my money and what it looks like?
^I'm just asking, Mrs. Rosa. No need to get defensive.
^Pah. I wouldn't if you weren't so rude.
^Hon, it's okay. We're okay, right, Mr. Trilby?
